Core Concepts.commentary: The seeds of thought and being. These words root our speech in the most fundamental ideas — life, death, self, nothingness. Use them sparingly and with intention.

Emotions & States.commentary: Feelings are rivers that carve the landscape of our lives. These words name those currents. Speak them to name your inner weather.

Kinship & People.commentary: No one walks alone. Here are the names for those who share your path — family, friends, strangers — and all the bonds that bind you.

Nature.commentary: Stones, trees, beasts, and sky. This cluster grounds you in the living world. Learn these names to honour the spirits you meet.

Elements & Weather.commentary: Fire and water, wind and earth. These words conjure the elemental forces and the moods of the sky. Whisper them to call the storm or calm it.

Time & Cosmos.commentary: Above and below, before and after. The celestial dance of sun, moon, and stars. These terms measure the world and map the heavens.

Society & Craft.commentary: Villages, tools, trades, and the works of hands and hearts. Use these words to speak of the societies we build and the crafts we ply.
